summary: This is a sealed transcript of a conference before Chief District Judge Colleen McMahon regarding a grand jury subpoena (19 Misc. 149). The government attorney explains that the investigation opened in late November/early December 2018 and that the U.S. Attorney's Office had contacted the Boies Schiller law firm, among others, regarding their representation of victims or witnesses. The judge grants the government's request related to the subpoena.

persons.name: Colleen McMahon
persons.context: Presiding judge over the sealed grand jury subpoena conference. She questions the government about contacts with the Boies Schiller firm prior to issuing the subpoena.

persons.name: Geoffrey S. Berman
persons.role: United States Attorney for the Southern District of New York
persons.context: Listed as the United States Attorney in the appearances section of the transcript.

events.title: Investigation Opened (Approx. Date)
events.description: The government attorney states the investigation was opened either on Friday, November 30, or Monday, December 3.

events.title: Investigation Opened (Alternative Date)
events.description: The government attorney states the investigation was opened either on Friday, November 30, or Monday, December 3.

events.title: Sealed Court Conference
events.description: A sealed conference before Judge McMahon regarding a grand jury subpoena. The government explains its investigation timeline and contacts with victim/witness counsel, and the judge grants the government's request.

locations: United States District Court Southern District of New York
keyFacts: The document is a sealed court transcript from a conference regarding a grand jury subpoena (19 Misc. 149).
The government investigation into the subject (implied to be related to Jeffrey Epstein) opened in late November or early December 2018.
The U.S. Attorney's Office contacted the Boies Schiller law firm, identified as representing victims or witnesses, early in the investigation.
Judge Colleen McMahon grants the government's request related to the subpoena after questioning them about pre-subpoena contacts with counsel.
